intro: Oligomeris dipetala var. dipetala, commonly known as the two-petaled olive, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Oleaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers with two petals. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, elliptical fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in chaparral and woodland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive species in conservation efforts.
